MS MCQs

    Understand Microsoft 365 resiliency and continuity - Summary and knowledge check

    »

    1. What frequency of Capability Validation is required by the Microsoft BCM lifecycle?

      At least once per calendar year

      At least once per quarter

      Within 12 months of the last test


    2. Which of the following is a phase of the BCM lifecycle?

      Disaster Recovery

      Assessment

      Workforce Disruption


    3. Which one of these statements inaccurately describes Microsoft 365’s resiliency and continuity?

      Microsoft 365 Services are deployed with Active/Passive design.

      Exchange Online Database Availability Groups is one example of fault isolation.

      The Planning phase of the BCM lifecycle focuses on developing and implementing resilience and recovery strategies, as well as documenting them in official business continuity plans.


    4. How often are capacity models reviewed and updated at Microsoft?

      At least once per calendar year

      At least once per quarter

      Within 12 months of the last update


    5. Which team at Microsoft is responsible for driving business continuity sponsorship, awareness, resource allocation, and program accountability across Microsoft business units?

      Business Continuity Council

      EBCM Program Management Office

      Service teams
